description:
Great Starbucks
And great staff
I forgot my bag with lap top and they saved it for me
When I came back they gave it back to me
I am so so happy
Soy chai was very good too
author: Bill T.

description:
Still a 4 star rating since I love the atmosphere but...heads up...it can be busy in here since it's on a popular street!

I was able to grab the last chair available when I came in to get some work done.
author: Matt M.

description:
It's a comfy location. Friendly staff. Plenty of space. I didn't need to hear the lame attempt at hitting on a chick by some guy who waltzed in for a mocha on that day (trust me she didn't either. It was cringe) but I was coming from my neurologist down the street and needed some caffeine to help with my migraine desperately. 

It is a chain. It's Starbucks. It's not your local coffee shop, but the vibe in here was decent and I'd return if/when needed.
author: Bella B.

description:
Ashley ! Her action was so rough when  I tell her my order still having 1 more . ( I had total 9 orders ) and she told me with so strong rough action
 " OKAY "  and she looking at me with hatred eyes . maybe she doesn't like me because, when I come to Starbucks I had a lot of order differently drink for my friends working with me . so sad for Starbucks
author: Vivian H.

description: I'm always at this Starbucks because my friend lives nearby on Union St. I stop by to get fizzy drinks like San Pellegrino...sometimes I will get a brownie or sausage muffin. Good service. Runs well. Meet up or hang out briefly.
author: Denise C.

description: Paid $5 dollars for milk basically and the barista said it's because they're running out of ice...so my drink has no coffee or syrup because you have no ice? Also, the guy taking orders doesn't know what matcha is. .....dude, you work at Starbucks, it's on the menu. Oh and barista complaining about how tired he is while serving half assed drinks. Major eyeroll, bad form on your part. Only here to charge phones anyway, or we wouldn't bother.
author: Astrid V.

description: Mikee was super nice! (If I remember his name correctly) very friendly and patient. He knew I was in town visiting from the convo we were having, so he recommended a cool place to check out. Thank you again for the awesome customer service and will definitely  come back to this location.
author: Dani S.

description: One of the better Starbucks, with ample seating and outlets, two bathrooms, used to be open late, but hours got cut back in 2018.
author: John N.

description: Convenient location. Decent service. But, can you play better music? Its always Jazz or 50's stuff. Its like elevator music. Or just don't play anything at all!!!
author: Klaus W.

description:
I had the pleasure of visiting the first Starbucks cafe to open in San Francisco (1992). By East Coast standards, that may not be impressive but in California that probably gets you a historic permit of sorts. The building itself is actually old, dating back to 1899 if i'm not mistaken.  

I encountered this location as I passed by on the north side of Union street, first thinking I had spotted a dimly lit and quaint restaurant. Out front there's a row of trees, their leaves partially obscuring, to charming effect, the monolithic Starbucks Coffee lettering on the upper ledge of the front interior.

The entrance felt profound, an open space with beautifully worn wooden tiles leading to the counter. You can't help but look up at the vintage features of the ceiling--opaque lights hanging from an ornate ceiling base and grayish-blue square ceiling tiles with a silky matte finish. Leather seats can be found in the front, with a view of bustling Union street, and in the back, with quick access to restrooms.

On the left side of the space, there's a long communal wooden table with seating for up to twelve, just one short of a miracle. Inspired souls work quietly on their school work and resumes, and presumably some are writing their Yelp reviews. The table faces a ribbed textured royal blue wall framed by dark brown wooden panels. 

Overall, an amazing experience. You know, the iced coffee with Hazelnut favoring wasn't too bad either.
author: Behnam S.

description:
Very good visit. The staff was very busy but at least they lett me know that i would be helped soon. Very real smile from both the (young) girl and boy. 
What I noticed was that the room was full with working people behind their laptop! Never saw so many working people at a coffee place before.
The toilet was clean! (There are 2 restrooms with both 1 toilet) 

I had a flat white and a lemon pound cake. The cake tasted good but can be a little bit fresher. 
I liked this Starbucks very much
author: Fanny B.

description: The staff was not paying attention at all!!! Worst survice ever ... not the standard I expect from Starbucks...
author: Kerstin H.

description: I love Starbucks! I go to this Starbucks every single day and sometimes twice a day they're amazing! My favorite drink is a hot caramel macchiato super delicious! I really do love Starbucks although I was very disappointed because their employee Scarlet is very rude and so the last time I went I was ordering my caramel macchiato like always and as Scarlet was making my coffee she had bumped my cup and knocked a large amount of my drink out of the cup almost all of the expresso that she had just put in. The outside of my cup was stained Brown with expresso. I got a ways down the street I took a sip I realized my coffee  did not taste like it had any espresso in it. it tasted just like caramel and milk which it pretty much was at that point. I would have gone back but I was on my break and I had to go. Needless to say I was very disappointed with Scarlett's customer service she has shown poor customer service in the past this although this time I was also disappointed with my drink that she made. I still love Starbucks and I still will continue to go there every day. Although I'm hoping for better customer service next time and to have my drink make the proper way.
author: Emily K.

description: Ugh, Was in line and just saw an employee dumping trash and then going right to serve food without washing their hands.  Management needs to teach their employees sanitary.  Not going back there again.  Think again before you take a bite.
author: Calvin J.

description: Horrible service. Made a mobile order and waited 20 minutes. Asked about the order and the barista said something about another thing not working. BUT the slip with my order was sitting on the counter. They just didn't fulfill it and tried to lay blame elsewhere. Come on man!
author: Scott K.

description: Not consistent. I work in the area and only come to Starbucks because it's convenient. I get the same drink and it never tastes the same. Sometimes they remember the vanilla, sometimes they forget and sometimes it's the sweetest thing ever!! Ordered an everything bagel and received a cinnamon raisin??? Please improve!!!
author: Hope B.

description: A really charming Starbucks. Nice and relaxed atmosphere, the servers are really sweet. I had a lovely seat in the window to read and drink my coffee before I had to get on my way. A little small but they have restrooms, wifi, and a good ambiance. The parking is available on the street by meter. I got lucky to find one right by this Starbucks on my way to the Vegan Picnic (my original destination) and walked inside to have a cup because it looked so pretty! The people watching is great too!
author: Kelly B.

description:
Decently sized Starbucks with limited seating on Union and Laguna. What meets the eye is the well designed interior - wooden walls, dark themed.

Toilet is accessible without key/pin, no seating outside. Outlets can be found to your left when you enter the store.

Good luck finding seating - the few chairs/sofas are always taken.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
My daughter is here from Portland and my niece from New Mexico 
It would be nice if the staff at this location would at least smile
author: Sheryl M.

description:
I never write reviews for Starbucks because you usually know what you're getting yourself into, but I'll make an exception here. I came to get some work done before a meeting, and I was so impressed by the variety of seating! I posted up along the back banquette thing, and was so cozy on a chilly SF afternoon. It made me feel like I was doing work in an old timey library. There's also a long table with reading room-style lamps on the wall behind it and about five arm chairs closer to the window. Music was ambient and not distracting. Would definitely recomment for getting work done!

My drink was exactly what you'd expect- the same as every other Starbucks, but the decor put this one over the edge for me!
author: Alex G.

description: I wake up. I feel the hole in my heart begin to be filled by black. Is this the day she shall return? Were it, not for the Starbucks being so close to my house, I fear I would waste away in a cozy bed of painful emotions. Coffee, cigarettes, the only comfort I can find in this world. I enjoy my decaf skinny mocha frappicino in the oversized chair by the window. Gazing out to the street. Is this the day she shall return? The decor is charcoal stained hard wood. The staff is hard working and oblivious to my blood shot eyes from sleepless nights spent tossing and turning. I return home. Return to bed. The black hole in my heart remains. Is this the day she shall return?
author: Andrew P.

description:
From lattes to cappucinos to frappes, my late husband used to love taking me here to "Bucks" as he would call it.

Great baristas.
Cute cups and doohickies for sale.

Later, a great first coffee date for new potential beaus.
Friendly chatty chummy baristas.
Tip well, my friend.

Sipping on the outside bench, we did see gay star Olympian Brian Boitano stroll by.
author: April B.

description:
I wanted to like this location, since it's on Union St. and has a sunny and bright outlook. I've been frequenting it this summer, but probably no more. Not that they care...

- Don't ask for your free Iced tea, iced coffee, or hot brewed coffee as a refill on your purchased drink if you stay in the store - they simply refuse to honor Starbucks refill policy, which is "free refills to Starbucks Rewards members - regardless of original beverage purchased - if you stay in the store - and pay with your registered card". Further more, they refuse to read it off their own website if offered!

- One of the restrooms is closed as "non-working, to be fixed real soon", not sure if that note is a permanent fixture or what, since it's been there three weeks ago as well as today. Another restroom doesn't have any toilet paper in it, nor paper towels, and they didn't bother to stock it up in about an hour and a half that I've been there on Saturday afternoon.

- People are smoking in front of this location constantly and there's no escape: they stand around the corner and  just by the doors, blowing the smoke in and around. They leave burning cigarette butts on top of mail distribution box while running in, throw used butts on the ground when they are done smoking, etc. Theres is no not-smoking sign displayed on the door that I could see and point it out. My companion has asthma and almost got into an asthma attack before we realized what was going on and rushed out of there.
author: Grey R.

description: Friendly service, a bit dark inside but otherwise nice place to get snacks.
author: Aaron S.

description: I like the Starbucks closer to us on Fillmore the most in the city. I am a Peet's drinker myself however I do like a Venti Green Tea Iced Tea sometimes, and I think Starbucks black iced coffee rocks1 It taste better than Peet's 'iced coffee' yet Peet's coffee is what tickles my fancy more so. So Starbucks is my part time coffee tea lover... lol
author: Kirk M.

description: This store is very spacious with plenty of seats to study but the staff was terrible. The girl who took my order, Lupe, was obviously not trained well enough to be taking orders.. I understand it takes time and practice to get orders right but even after i told her i wanted an apple fritter FIVE TIMES and literally pointed to it, she still didn't know what i was talking about and said "oh, we don't have it.. we have apple juice?" One of the baristas had to go and get it for her BUT SHE WAS JUST AS BAD. She tossed the apple fritter towards me and when I asked for it to be warmed up, she just walked away. Later, another barista had to call my name and re-confirm my drink order cus Lupe didn't write it down properly.
author: S S.

description: this is my favorite that I usually go. lovelovelove their customer Service. their white chocolate mocha is always the best chose for me. I would recommend this place to my friends.
author: May H.

description:
One of the worst Starbucks experience !
There was a fly in the food section and even on complaining the cashier did not seem to care! My hibiscus very berry drink was not made up to the mark ! I asked her to redo it and she did it but with a very bad look, and yet was pretty bad! The staff weren't friendly and were talking loudly among themselves as well !!
Would never visit this branch again :(
author: Priyanka P.

description:
All I have to say is.... KELLY! I'm new to the Union area and now that I work on the street, I frequent this Starbucks nonstop. 
Besides the fact that my drinks are always great and the wait is never long at all, I LOVE Kelly! She's so nice and upbeat and friendly to everyone and deserves 10 instead of 5 stars.
author: Natalie M.

description: What can I say, it's a Starbucks. We all know what they are about. This is the closest one to my work so I come in often and have never had an issue. The employees are friendly and the place is kept clean. There is free wifi and space to do work. It has a relaxing vibe even though it's on a crazy busy street.
author: Laura K.

description:
This location is apparently the first starbucks in SF, and they picked a very popular spot for the first one. It sits on the corner, but its actually a fairly large location. They have a long table, and several tables in the back to work at. They also have some nice plush chairs that face the windows -- perfect for people watching!

It's a comfortable starbucks. I saw them a couple of times handing out samples, which is nice to see.

I was sitting at the bar for most of the morning, and props to the barista that was there. Without even asking, she offered a cup of water for me (just because I had been there awhile). Appreciate the customer service!
author: Ashley S.

description: This Starbucks has the best homey feel you could ask for. I'm imagining the seats in the bay window would be perfect for studying or relaxing and having a conversation. Service is excellent as well. Now set that all aside! When I went into the bathrooms they were disgusting! I felt like I was in a public 7/11 bathroom. (No hard feelings) I didn't want to touch anything, and when I went to wash my hands there was no way for me to even dry my hands! This place could use some work, but could be a gem. (Smells a little weird as well)
author: Micah B.

description:
I've been going to this Starbucks for the last couple days and even a loyal customer for three years as a gold card member. All I can say is I'm very disappointed with service even the store manager Kim. 

Kim didn't seen to care for customers even if I said I work across the street from Starbucks and been a loyal customer for years! 

On the other hand Alex and Kelly made me feel like home! 

Honestly there's nothing I can do!
author: Linh P.

description:
Got bad treatment and comments behind my back and rolled eyes from the barista (she claimed she is the incharge) as I asked for steamed milk after payment as I didn't know they charge for it. I read the policy and figured they wouldn't be charging if the milk to be steamed is less than 4 oz and conveyed it to her politely!! She says I would have drank over 4oz over years!! Can you believe that? 
 Starbucks should give more customer service training to its employees and teach them how to treat customers!
author: Rose M.

description:
At 2pm today I visited this Starbucks after an appointment I had in the area.  The customer walking in before me held the door for me and even said I could go ahead of her because she had no idea what she wanted.   I got the the register and was greeted with "What do you want to order?".....I said, "Hello with a smile and said how are you" and got no response.  We all have a bad day but this is not the service I am accustomed to at my favorite coffee shop.  Then the barista makes my Valencia orange drink and instead of shaking it as Starbucks is known for she fills the glass, put a lid on it and in front of me at the serving bar she shakes the glass in front of me without saying a word..... and then just hands it off.    

Store manager....please instill the Starbucks culture into these two baristas as they haven't a clue why they are here today.  I have been drinking Starbucks since 1990 and have never seen such a disconnect as I did today.
author: Jeff S.

description: Ask for Desiree. She's the best and will make sure you are happy. She provided amazing customer service in my time of need (and she was about to go home!).
author: Kirsten L.

description:
The new renovation has done this store a huge service.  Considering the customer service is a bit slow, the remodel gives you a second to look around and admire the detail and clientele that frequents high end stores such as what you see on Union Street.

My drink took about 7 minutes with only 1 person with 1 drink ahead of me.  Much different than Starbucks old motto of 3-3.5 minutes per customer from the point of getting to the register.  I believe this is in the philosophy that coffee is an experience and should not be rushed. 

The sore is beautiful.  Truly is.  If you're a fan of Starbucks you'll have to come check this place out on your way out or into the city.  Just be sure you're ok with a little wait, and not enough seating for the patrons who frequent this establishment.
author: Kevin J.

description: The staff here is great !! Everyone always has a positive attitude which is why I always come here on my lunch breaks. Haha
author: Giselle J.

description: This is an awesome location. This Starbucks is in a nice area. Also it is nice inside. This is one of the best Starbucks locations in San Francisco. I also like it that I can get free WiFi here from Xfinity from Comcast. The WiFi is outside the store. But you can hook up to it from inside this Starbucks. I would recommend this location to any that loves Starbucks as much as I do.
author: Isaac H.

description: They have a clover machine!! YESSSSSSS. Love the baristas! They move at lightening speed in the morning which is exactly what I need to get my day going!
author: Tina S.

description: I work not to far from this location and it is awesome!!! The staff, the food, the coffee, everything is really great!!!
author: Jesse JG G.

description: Always disappointed coming to this location, a few weeks back before coming into work just a block down, I had asked for an egg nog latte with no milk. Super simple, no problems whatsoever. The next day however, I went in the morning again asking for the same exact thing, the lady taking my order said "There's no such thing...." I was confused but didn't want to argue so i let it go. After weeks of not coming to this location. I made an online order, just a peppermint hot chocolate and an everything bagel with cream cheese, as it says on the app. While on the clock a block down by the way.... I went in and picked up my order. There was no cream cheese. I asked the lady and said "it doesn't come with cream cheese" she said, "no it would say on the order." It did say on my online order when i payed for it and all. It was busy, and didn't feel like being the on customer wasting everyone else's time. Especially because i was on the clock and made an online order for a reason.
author: Marlena M.

description:
I actually like coming here to get some work done on their large wooden tables as long as there's space. The comfy chairs in the front by the windows are always taken but a nice place to read a newspaper and sit very very close to strangers.

Their coffee and pastries are pretty standard. The staff is very friendly though.

My favs are the java chip frapp and any and all holiday beverages!

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description: Wow! Fabulous Starbucks. My husband and I entered about five minutes before closing. Nancy immediately greeted us with an upbeat and friendly voice.  She was very helpful and provided superior customer service. The bathroom was sparkling clean and the dining room was warm and inviting. The other female associate was also friendly and wished us a nice night. We will be back!
author: Stella K.

description:
Ok, Starbucks on Union, let's talk. I'm a huge fan of Starbucks in general. It's tasty, it has the drinks I like, it's reliable and it's fast. 

There's a Starbucks by my office, there's one near my apartment...and then there's you. You're the prettiest for sure, and that makes me visit you. But why oh why do you have the slowest service of all the starbucks in the land?

You're too convenient since you're on Union Street, but just wish the service was a little speedier...
author: Lisa R.

description: These guys are GREAT! awesome customer service and they're usually on point with the flow of people in the AM. Thanks to Kelly for always being rockstar fast shaken up my iced double shot specially when I'm late to work
author: Melanie D.

description:
Awesome friendly service. The girl at the register today was so friendly that it really made my day. These days it's hard to come by genuinely happy people working the counter. 

Oh, coffee is good too. And there are an ample amount of seats.
author: Juliana K.

description:
Just another branch that is the giant corporation of Starbucks. Doesn't really matter if i rate this one star, three stars or 5 stars...it's Starbucks. Basic Starbucks. I doubt yelp ratings will affect Starbucks sales in any way. 
With all that in mind, i feel bad for the employees who have to put up with the snotty folks of this neighborhood. You there, reading this review, I know it doesn't matter but think about the location of this Starbucks. People who come here often enough to review this joint are probably snotty so their reviews are pretty unreliable. Every other Starbucks in the city has better reviews. Think about that distribution and the disconnect. It's the type of people they service.  Not to say that all the reviews for this location is invalid but take that small detail into consideration the next time you're browsing Yelp to decide which Starbucks location deserves your business. 
Not like these reviews matter all that much anyhow! There's a Pete's in the same area that I would much rather visit. Yeah, it's suspicious and I'll admit, I'm a Pete's fan here to sabotage Starbucks. Perhaps the motive of all the rest of the low reviews are akin to my motivation. it's a Pete's vs. Starbucks kind of situation here. But not really. No skin off my back.  In any case, just tip them even if you're gonna leave a crappy review. At least do that much and don't be an ass.
author: Tu L.

description:
I go to Starbucks pretty much every Sunday (sorry...I don't care that it's a chain or "corporate" or whatever...I prefer Starbucks espresso (but necessarily the brewed coffee) to most coffee shops).  I've only reviewed one other Starbucks though since it's the one I got to M-F.  For the most part, this is my usual Sunday Starbucks, and I come here when I'm not hungover and go to spin class at the Crunch a couple blocks down.

The store itself is nice.  It's clean, big, has a lot of seating & even has two condiment bars, which I like.  When I get my iced Americano here I'm pretty much in and out, so I really don't have a good "feel" for the place.  I can say that it's ALWAYS packed (on Sunday mornings anyway...and the few times I've stopped in Saturday mornings)!  Like, line out the door packed.  I'm not knocking them for that.  As long as you can handle the crowds, more power to you! 

The main reason I'm knocking a couple stars off is because usually when I'm in here, the partners/baristas commit the one service mistake that gets to me...they're always yelling & arguing at each other right in front of customers!  And I mean ALWAYS.  Like I said, I'm pretty laid back when it comes to critiquing service, but that bothers me.  I can't complain about the way the employees handle customers face to face though.  I've never experienced a problem there.  They make mistakes with my drink every now and then, but no biggie.  They'll remake it and it's all good...
author: George A.

description:
Well, it's a Starbucks, there's really not much else to say about it. The bathrooms are clean, its usually pretty easy to get a table, lots of outlets for computers... overall, I'd say it's a nice Starbucks. People up front are friendly, drinks always turn out the same as they do at all the other Starbucks'. They aren't the speediest, but it's Cow Hollow, not the FiDi, so really what can you expect? You want your Latte in under 2 minutes, hit the one on Montgomery and Sutter (yes, the one with the line out the door - it's insane how fast they get through that line).

It only gets three stars though because of the internet speed.  It's fine if all you want to to do is surf Facebook and write an email in Gmail, but for anything else (i.e, connecting to a remote desktop) it's excruciatingly slow. Makes it a tough place to come to get some work done if you have to actually rely on the internet.
author: Mikaela H.

description: Great customer service. Fast and try to get to know you. Always busy so hard to do work, but love the seating-a nicely decorated Starbucks.
author: Kristen H.

description: I love this Starbucks! The coffee is obviously awesome. It is one of the cozier ones with nice couches and a long table. The staff is helpful too. And the location is pefrect!
author: Denise E.

description:
Ohhh I like this Starbucks....fairly big and lots of seating, clean bathrooms and very friendly staff.

Came here early Sunday morning since I needed a quick pick-me-up and to use the restroom. It was pretty crowded for a Sunday but our drinks were made quickly and with a smile. 

Bathrooms were clean as well and plenty of seating for you and a friend to come here for a cup of coffee.

Definitely would come here again when I come back into the area.
author: Monica L.

description: Love this Starbucks! It's one of my favorite ones!
author: Xuan C.

description: This is one of my favorite Starbucks to get work done in. The staff is friendly, there is plenty of seating (though still impossible to find during peak hour, so plan strategically), and it's an overall clean location. The only downsides are that the wifi can get slow, it's hella cold in here and sometimes they play really, really shitty music.
author: Vilde E.

description:
I can't rate this any more differently than the other 20 Starbucks in the general area but I will say this about Starbucks first. for the 2 years I worked on Union street I swear my bi-weekly paycheck went to breakfast at Starbucks and breakfast at Starbucks must be an anorexics dream because "Hi! Can I have one grande White Chocolate Mocha and a Chocolate Croissant"? warranted this response from the barista: "That'll be $9.36" This is what I heard every morning, resulting in overdraft fee's and no money for lunch or dinner for an 8 hr shift

Christ, $9.36?!?! For a meagre pastry, and a medium fucking coffee? Some breakfast, do they expect you to eat a huge breakfast before coming in or like spend $25.00 on 7-eleven food wrapped in their logo I swear, they need to put a Denny's on Union that has that 5 dollar grand slam to help take care of the poor kids that work 8 hr shifts on Union on minumum wage making $245 every two weeks. 

I'll give them this though; at all hours they were undoubtedly friendly and moved the long lines as quick as possible, even offering samples almost every day at all times that I would walk in. FREE SAMPLES GALORE =)

It has proven to be the worst study place imaginable because everyone seems to want to know what you're doing and on top of that there's rarely ever an available table ....

I was planning out my schedule for Fall Semester and this geezer kept looking at what I was writing, sipped his coffee, looked at me, looked back to what I was writing, looked at my books, schedule in hand, then back at me. I was like "GREAT, THIS GUY PROBABLY KNOWS I ATTEND A SHITTY COLLEGE, KNOWS IM TAKING A PHYSIOLOGY, CHEM AND TRYING TO SIGN UP FOR CHEERLEADING AND YOGA FML" I blankly stared at him til he got the point and resumed my duties.
author: Olivia Vanessa R.

description:
Starbucks has been growing on me.  I'm going through a Starbucks phaze I guess.  This location has particularly grown on me.  MC and I hang here by the window on the comfy brown chairs and watch the people stroll by while we work away on our laptops and construct lofty business ideas.  I swear this place will give birth to two new SF women entrepreneurs! 

Staff is always friendly and nice and the location is clean, comfy and welcoming.

p.s. come get my signature now!
author: Michele O.

description:
I hope someone from the store management reads this.

I would really like to come here more often to work, BUT the internet is so slow, it's just not worth it. If you need internet do not come here. 

PLEASE FIX THIS!
author: Felix B.

description:
I was desperate for H2O or any liquids in the afternoon today so thank goodness I walked by a Sbux. I have never tried the ice teas and being a gold card member I can finally cash in the rewards for free refills!

I got a tall sweetened green tea lemonade (GTL haha). My first cup had was filled almost to the brim with ice so I sipped up what liquid there was almost immediately. To get a refill, the barista has to swipe the gold card and you have to retain the lid and straw for reuse. I asked for less ice for cup #2 but that tasted strange. Cup #3 had a little more than just right but that was fine with me. 

There is so much seating at this location. I almost wish I carried my MacBook here just to be like everyone else. The staff here are so nice and courteous! There are outlets/plugs every few feet so you won't be without of power unless you forget your charger. I don't know if others notice but I don't recall being in another Starbucks with hardwood floors. One unique location. Because there is heavy foot traffic on Union, expect the door to open and close often and for noise to shuffle up and down.
author: Dominic T.

description: Recently remodeled with an efficient but cozy layout. A wide variety of people come here in the mornings: dressed up professionals, yogis, neighborhood retirees and students. The staff is super friendly and it does not take many visits before they know your name and order by heart.
author: Annika B.

description:
People: Very friendly
Wait: Several minutes
Food: four out of five

Knowing that I get to eat brie because it comes with the fruit:

Priceless.
author: Meg T.

description: Great place! Great service! Me and my girlfriend very very like that starbucks more then other!
author: David V.

description:
This has long been one of my favorite Starbucks, mainly for its size and decent availability of tables (at least on weekdays) and for the unmatched people-watching. The store was just remodeled, and the dark woods and brown leather are quite different than most Starbucks -- much more upscale.

That said, it seems like there are fewer places to sit after the remodel, as there's now one long communal table, two "high tables", and a small bar area that's smaller than before (I hope you like your neighbor).  There also seems to be an area to stand and drink your coffee, but it's not good for laptops or studying. At least the window seats are still there!
author: Jeff K.

description: Well starbucks is starbucks, coffee is usually pretty consistent at all of the locations but what stands out about this place is the staff. Always very friendly and have a smile on there face. I only come in when there is a parking spot available in front as im passing by when im on my way to work which doesnt happen very often. Even though im in here maybe once every other week they do remember my name and my order. Just wish that someone could finally spell my name right though! Demetri ???? Dimitry ??? Demitry??? Dimitri??? Would be interesting to see if anyone actually gets it right one of these days
author: Dmitriy G.

description:
This is my favorite Starbucks to stop by during my usual power walk. I always walk down and up the same streets to get to the Marina, and I always stop in this Starbucks to grab a hot latte. This is definitely one of the more spacious Starbucks in the city, and I have never had a problem finding seating here no matter what time of day it is. The staff is always friendly, and for some reason I think their drinks are always a bit better than any other Starbucks in this city. They make everything extra hot, just how I like it, and I don't even have to ask :)

Favorite breakfast here: Low fat turkey bacon and egg white sandwich with a skinny vanilla latte-- $6.
author: Ashley D.

description:
As a general rule, I avoid Starbucks and prefer Mom and Pop coffee shops, or even Peet's.  This place is close to my work so it's more convenient than Peet's down on Chestnut.  I like to get a medium 4 shot latte on my way in for a graveyard shift.  I don't know if that keeps me awake until 5 am, but it can't hurt!

I stock up on their instant Via coffee, and while it's not great, it's better than the coffee at work.

To me, it being A-OK when Starbucks are all over the place is about right.  Free Wi-Fi, nice seating, good service ... now if only half of the world's Starbuck's would disappear, I would rate it higher.
author: Michael M.

description: Great attitudes make for a pleasant experience. Wonderful staff in Cynthia, Chez, and the two others. Great place to visit!
author: Charles L.

description:
This location is not as friendly/bubbly as other Starbeezy locations. The best thing to share about this place is that there are eight comfy, brown sofa chairs (four in the front of the cafe & the other four in the back) where you can sit and get all your work done. If you have a laptop, then no worries because there is an outlet next to the sofa chair in front and the tables in the middle of the cafe. 

Also, if you're coming in after 7pm, don't expect to order any real food other than snacks. Another great thing is that it's right down the street from my place so I can walk over to get all my work done. Join the "attwifi" for free WiFi. I can't stand negative people and those who hate their job.  Can't live without coffee, Internet, or positive people. This place provides coffee and Internet, but where are the happy people? Show me the happy people and I'll give you the missing star.
author: Angellica Y.

description: I have never written a review but my experience today warrants one. The gentleman working was obnoxiously rude. I'm assuming he didn't know I ordered because when I asked for water, he said "I'm making drinks for customers." He then proceeded to talk about me (and my absurd request for water) with another coworker a mere few feet away from where I was standing. The whole thing was very uncomfortable and unpleasant
author: Michelle S.

description: I really like this location. The decor is a little more upscale with fancy leather seats. The staff is very friendly, the bathrooms are clean, and they serve la boulange pastries. This store is near a lot of restaurant and cute boutique shops which makes it a great spot to kill time before dinner or take a break from shopping.
author: Alice J.

description: Typical Starbucks, but maybe a little better atmosphere than usual.  Very friendly people behind the counter.
author: David P.

description:
I find that Starbucks vary in quality very substantially.  

This one is especially nice.  Fairly large space with a lot of seating - including some cushy chairs.  Adequate power outlets for personal computers.   

It's a Union Street "scene".  Fun.

They brew "bold" coffee all day.  Most Starbucks stop brewing bold at noon.  The Wifi is reliable, IMHO.
author: Art A.

description: Wow. I love the décor of this Starbucks --- sleek leather chairs looking out the front window for people watching, same texture leather couch in the back and a long, communal wooden table that lines the length of the store. Came here on a Friday morning, thinking there wouldn't be any open seats (since there's never any at the Fillmore area during work hours), yet there were plenty of seats and it seems the crowd here moves along much faster. The line, however, was long and took awhile to get to the front for our orders.
author: Angela S.

description:
This is the closest SBUX to my abode so I've been here many, many times. 

This is a very busy location during the daytime with usually about 40% long-term squatters with laptops and the rest with regular turnover. Despite this, I've only been denied a place to sit when I wanted to 2x. Lots of desks and outlets for your macbook fancy. 

Quality and consistency of the coffee is excellent at this location and service is friendly and fast. 

In addition, this is a great place to get an eyeful of the Pac Heights/Marina trophy wives/cougars/socialites/debutantes. For this reason, I am not able to be very productive here. 

But it's great for coffee on the go.
author: Shawn C.

description: This is the nicest looking Starbucks I've ever been in. Still can't give it 5 stars since their coffee is only OK.
author: Captain B.

description:
I live and work down the street from this location, so I'm always in here. The staff is really nice and the layout/setup is conducive to setting up your laptop and doing some work!

On a side note - I always try to bring my reusable mug/cup for eco friendly reasons. Recently I've noticed that some baristas will make/measure my drink using a plastic throwaway cup. When it's made, they'll pour it into my reusable cup, and toss the plastic one they used... Am I missing something here?? I know they have the reusable/washable cups to measure drinks out so I'm perplexed at why they'd use the throwaway ones.... especially for a customer that makes an effort to reduce waste by bringing her own mug...
author: Maria Y.

description: Efficient and nice staff. What more can you ask for at a Starbucks, eh?
author: Lena M.

description: This Starbucks location is surprisingly comfy and well maintained. Came in for a quick trip for coffee before my pilates class over at Mercury Fitness. Pleasant crowd, nice amber plush sofas. Will return next time:)
author: Ophelia Y.

description: I'm not a cafe person and I pretty much never spend money at starbucks or any other coffee place.... but I really like coming here to get work done. It's spacious, clean, and the servers will refill your tea with hot water all night :) WiFi is available at a cost and there are plenty of outlets.
author: Kimberly S.

description:
This place was jammed on a Saturday afternoon. Nevertheless, the wait was short and I managed to find a little seat afterwards. Coffee is your usual Starbucks fare, but the food was in short supply. No doubt that is attributable to the crush of customers eating everything sight.

Yet despite the crowds I found it to be very relaxing.
author: Stephen K.

description: Terrific service and unbelievably friendly baristas. The location on the corner is fantastic-perfect for doing homework on rainy afternoons.
author: Griffin H.

description:
Just me just say I am here far too often. 

This is a great place to come get some work done, read the newspaper, or chat with a friend. This location is big, clean, and often busy. The people who patron here are typically friendly, and as a person who revisits time and time again have noticed they definitely have many local Union St. Starbucks goers. 

The top three reasons I keep coming back: 
#3 - Clean bathrooms! 
#2 - Tasty iced caramel macchiato, every time! 
And the top reason I come back, and the reason you should come here, and tip well.... 
#1 - Wonderfully friendly baristas! So very nice, hardworking, and pleasant people. Gotta love 'em.
author: Sandy M.

description: I like it! A lot!! Best location of them all! So much better than the one on Fillmore.
author: Junie M.

description: This one of the most inviting Starbucks especially if you're looking for place to hang out and use the old MacBook for a couple of hours. The staff especially are great.
author: Alireza R.

description:
Today, I finally got around to using my starbucks gift card that I received as a going away present a couple months ago. The reason why, I haven't gotten around to using this card is because Starbucks, depending on the barista, is usually hit or miss (mostly miss, like way way way left of the goal post).

So, I went in to this Starbucks location and ordered a venti Caramel Macchiato. Oh bleh... this Macchiato never had a chance of scoring.

I do like the ambience here. A bunch of folks are chilling and enjoying their coffee, during mid-Monday morning.

But my dilemma is this. I can...

(A) Try ordering again next time... hoping to score.
(B) Repackage my Starbuck's card and.... Merry Christmas!!
author: Sam T.

description: This place contrary to Starbucks' corporate police charges for any soy milk but do not charge for regular milk. They are so busy they do not care about the non milk drinkers other than to fatten the wallets of this location. Might have good people working there but management is arrogant
author: Lawrence F.

description: Not overly crowded, nice atmosphere and plenty of electrical outlets. A little awkward how the comfy chairs are arranged facing out the window so the patrons look like an exhibit.
author: Karen M.

description: I came in at 6am this morning and there was no line at all. I was able to receive my blond roast coffee with sugar free vanilla and a spinach feta wrap all within 3-5 minutes. Awesome service and Great start to my day!
author: Amanda N.

description:
Going here is like a box of chocolates you never know what you will get :)

Seriously 90% of the time great service but 10% of the time they will mess up your order or make you wait forever or give you 90% ice in your Black Ice tea where the appears to be Pale Brown or yellow in Color.
author: Amit S.

description:
The barristas and cashiers at this Starbucks are perhaps the most patient and most tolerant milk-steaming, vanilla-pumping brewmasters in all the wide world of Starbucks.  

I mean, imagine what they have to deal with on a daily basis at this location. (Why yes, I do say that with a heavy dose of ironic self-deprecation, given that I basically live around the corner).  

Plus, they all dressed up in costumes on Halloween --  A+ attitudes in this place.
author: Ann M.

description: 5 reasons I love this Starbucks: 1) the Service is fast; 2) lots of room to sit and enjoy your coffee unless it's Sunday; 3) the front windows are perfect for people watching; 4) The line is never too long and most importantly; 5) they ALWAYS get your order right!
author: Thomas A.

description:
If you came onto Yelp and wrote a negative review on your neighborhood STARBUCKS, complaining about the bad service or how they missed the extra 1/2 shot of espresso on your "Grande in a Venti, 1/2 nonfat, 1/2 soy, vanilla latte, 190-degrees, no foam, with whip, with a pump of hazelnut syrup, and sprinkle of cinnamon on top," you are an Asshole (oh yes, capital 'A'), and your mother/father/the El Salvadorian maid who actually raised you should have beaten you as a child.

I mean, yes, it's Starbucks. Yes, their brewed coffee tastes like gasoline. And yes, I spend $4 on roughly 8oz of milk, espresso, a dash of artificial syrup, and 8oz of ice, everyday. But the staff here is amiable, neighborly (I work two doors down), and always gets my drink out in 5 minutes with a line to the door at 1015 in the morning. Evil corporate machine or not, Starbucks is consistent, and when I'm running late and need a java fix, no one is more convenient. You don't have to come here if this type of service or business is unacceptable to your standards. I mean, really. Don't come here.

This store gets four stars from me because of jerks like you.
author: Sachi T.

description:
Waiting in line... 

Marina girl wearing work out clothing (*A SATURDAY/SUNDAY TRADITION ON UNION ST!), "I'd like a double frappachino with mint foam and EXTRA sweetner." I wait another five minutes hearing the machine queaf out steam for lady to pay her 5 dollar drink with a credit card. 

Now, my turn fuckers:

"I'd like a large ice coffee please."

"You mean an Americano?"

"Yes, just put the coffee on the ice."

"And you would like it grande?"

"I'd like a large coffee thanks."

"You mean a grande?"

"Yes, I guess so. I'm a simple man."

Thank you miss for giving me the card to the corporate subscription. But for now, please give me me the mud beans and shut the fuck up. 

On the exit paths... "Why are all these losers sitting in here with their laptops? is WI-Fi really that hard to come by? is a wireless router expensive? Are they working or just trying to look cool?"

Awesome!
author: Andreas T.

description: I really like this Starbucks, mainly because of the layout and location. First off, perfect location on the corner of Union and Laguna. Great meeting place and its central in the Marina. Love the nice large lounge chairs in the windows always filled with people entrenched in work or a good book, its very homey looking and just passing by always makes me want to stop in, get a grande drip and pull up a recliner and my favorite book.
author: Krista S.

description:
Starbucks evil? Don't know..
Women in tight pants? confirmed...

Tall double shot light caramel macchiato please... this is now my fave, thanks for that cool barista guy! 

Hang around and open my laptop - - - trying to be cool?  Nah! just killing time.
And having these beautiful people around makes me forget the music they're playing.... but it's just me.
author: Bernard V.

description: I just have to say- props to their employee ( the smaller man- don't know his name) who ran outside during a torrential rain storm to clean out a crazy flooding gutter. Clearly above and beyond.
author: Jennifer K.

description: This is a wonderful Starbucks.  It's super close to my work and where I spend most of my day which is why I started going there.  But I keep going back, because the morning staff is so friendly.  They remember names and greet you as you walk in the door.  There is quite a bit of seating, however, despite this, I still struggle to find a seat sometimes!  Overall, a great place to pass time in between appointments.
author: Shannon W.

description:
Starbucks bashing is pretty-much yesterday's yesterday's news, so I won't pile it on here. Yeah, ok, so some of the ultra-marina chicks roll in here clicking their gum, showing their bum, and sound "like-aah" way dumb, but I won't talk about that. Instead I will focus on the good things. 

As far as Starbucks goes, this one is pretty good. Decent atmosphere, some cool local art (http://www.timharpersf.com/), nice chairs/couches, coffee that is much better than the office kitchen's, the paper, good people watching, and breakfast sandwiches. Reduced-fat turkey bacon, baby!

Notice how I didn't even talk about the busy crowd of people "working" on their business plans and screenplays. I'm way above going there.

One comment from my friend Jeremy (a Union St. Starbucks and marina girl expert): 25 stars from 7-9 in the morning.  4 stars the rest of the day!
author: Dave L.

description:
"What if a spider falls in my drink?  Gross!  Last, and I guess I shouldn't hate on vagrants, but why does the staff have to be all lovey-dovey to the smelly folks that call Starbucks home."  

The above quote is from a really embarassing review of this place posted in July--and after laughing at that yelper's tragic experience (spiders?  OMG vagrants???) I think the fine staff at this Starbucks deserves 5 stars just for having to deal with people like her.  And apparently they have to deal with vagrants (heaven forbid we humanize them by calling them "homeless people") and falling spiders too!

But I actually intended to give them 5 stars even before reading that embarassing review because the staff here has always been top-notch.  And contrary to the aforementioned rant, I've never seen anything "icky" at this Starbucks, let alone anything so "icky" i'd have to yell "eeeeeeew!" and run to the safety of another shop.  This cafe is always clean, and looks fab after its remodel.

What makes a Starbucks great is a great staff--otherwise it's just another Starbucks.  There are only 3 Starbucks in the bay area that I would consider truly great--this one, the one on Burlingame Ave, and the one next to the Safeway @ Church & Market.

PS--the funny thing is, all of the one-star reviews say nothing about this particular Starbucks.
author: Eric E.

description: I visit this coffee shop several times a week. It's frequently visited by people who work from home, as you'll see the main table is packed with laptops and people working away. But I've rarely not found a seat for myself, especially if I wait a few minutes. It's a popular spot for men to gather and chat, so don't sit in the four chairs by the window unless you want to join in or listen in to their conversations.
author: J K.

description:
It may seem a little strange to be reviewing a Starbucks because really, how different can they be unless you experience terrible service at one? Well, I happen to think this Starbucks location stands out.

It's larger, for one thing, and always really cheerful (both the staff and the decorations), making it a nice place to hang out and read and enjoy your coffee. Great people watching as well.

So it's just a Starbucks in the end, but it's a particularly nice one.
author: Sophie D.

description:
It turns out that I was premature in my last review about this Starbucks. Not only have the people become extremely less attentive (ie, I constantly ask LITE ICE NO ROOM and get LOTS ICE INCHES OF ROOM)  but they also charge you for your order, then conveniently  forget to even give you all that you ordered.

This morning I ordered a breakfast sandwich, coffee and a brownie. I was given the brownie and my coffee (although it was again, NOT HOW I ORDERED IT), and somehow someone forgot that there was a sandwich I ordered. I waited just about 15 minutes, before I finally gave up and walked out. I left all the things I did get there, I hadnt even taken a single sip of coffee! Yes, I straight up walked out rather then make a scene when there was at least 8 people in line. 

I wrote their Seattle offices about this, and will be disputing the charge on my credit card when it posts. I also will NEVER be returning to ANY Starbucks worldwide, because of this one incident. 

Sorry but this is probably the WORST Starbucks Ive been to and WORST experience Ive ever had at ANY coffee company.
author: William D.

description:
I find it hilarious that Starbuck's bought out La Torrefizone three years ago (which is two doors down right next to the Bus Stop bar) as part of their localized global takeover strategy, only to shut down the mom and pop and increase their traffic flow. I was really bummed when I heard about that because I realized that they (Starbuck's) used to do that in other suburban communities as well year's ago.  

But the joke came to be on them in the end because there is now a local french boulangerie chain who subsequently bought the lease and opened up their local shop 2 weeks later.  This will now be their 5th location in the city...

Can't put a finger on the sun...and I feel better about the world and smile to myself everytime I stroll by...
author: Yelper A.

description:
Speedy baristas and a mid- union street potty break favorite stop of mine. I think I'll make mine a double.

I love the light in this location too- if you get a seat in the window, don't give it up...great people watching!
author: Diane S.

description:
Starbucks has horrible coffee. I am sometimes (rarely) forced to get a cup of this crap when I am desperate.  Today was an example of such desperation...the coffee sucked. 
That is all I have to say.
author: Nilu r.

description:
Boycott Starbucks and the evil corporation it is! 
However, if you aren't going to boycott, like how I become a sucker to the thing every holiday with their Pumpkin Spice Lattes, at least go to a good one.
This is a good one. One of the few with retro-chairs and they still serve you your coffee in the mugs (unlike many Starbucks who seem to have lost that art.)
The staff is friendly and the freaking make the premade-recipe coffee CORRECTLY.
author: Liz L.

description: This is a great starbucks coffee. Well located with comfy chairs by the windows, the staff will let you stay there and work in peace for a few hours. Very nice and fun neighborhood.
author: Alma A.

description:
I don't know how I feel about Starbucks, the company, but I have to say that this Cow Hollow location has provided a nice place to study as I cram for finals.

They've redone the interior since last semester's cram-a-thon.  There are lots of big comfy chairs and free wi-fi now.  Not a bad place to while away the hours...and hours....and hours.
author: Carolyn H.

description: It's Starbucks. 1 star deduction for that. But the fact that they shell out your coffee just the way you want it and at a record pace, its definately a plus for me.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
Grande, Two-Pump Vanilla, Soy Latte, please!  When I order this they just look at me and smile. How the Barristas tolerate all of our finicky orders is beyond me but they do! And graciously if I might add. 

This particular Starbucks is just around the corner from my house and holds a special place in my heart as far as corporate coffee goes. There have been many a morning where I've rolled out of bed in my pajamas and slippers and walked up the hill to grab my morning fix. 

Sometimes I stay and enjoy my NY Times, watching with glee as all my fellow early risers maniacally fight their way to the counter shouting orders. Other times I schlep back down the street to my apartment - either way, this particular spot always puts a smile on my face and a, "mmmm" on my lips.
author: Julia N.

description: I had to meet up with a friend at this place. Wow, I didn't know that this place is huge. There was plenty of seating inside, like the couches, tables, and even bigger tables so you can do some web surfing or homework. The time I went was around the evening and this place was packed. I didn't really have a hard time finding a seat as I was waiting for my mocha coffee. It's a nice place to just hang out and it wasn't messy at all. If you are looking for the restroom, it needs a code requirement.
author: Eric E.

description:
this is the best starbucks in town, fast and friendly, not to mention, lots of single ready to mingle people....

H-E-L-L-O nurse!

@};-
author: Stanley K.

description:
Some of the best customer service I've had at a Starbucks. Went here on a busy Sat afternoon and the girl working the counter was super friendly, funny, and not fake nice like at other Starbucks. Cool place to hang out and watch all the pretty people pass by and through Starbucks on Union St. 

Bottom line: Two thumbs up to this Starbucks.
author: Jim C.

description:
I usually just come here on weekends..and on saturday mornings it is crowded. Which is good...all the people are really good-looking. However - I really don't care to hear details about what the barista did on friday night . I NEED my coffee now!
But the window seats and the chairs are very comfy....
author: Conny F.

description:
This Starbucks is my unofficial personal HQ on weekends, and my Third Place on weekday mornings at oh-dark-thirty.

The baristas are so friendly I'm considering adding a few of them to my Christmas card list.
author: Christian R.

description:
Yuck!

So my wireless was down and I decided to stop in here to grab drink and check the status on a few semi-urgent emails.  When I reached down to plug in my laptop near the front bar...eeeeew....the floor was so icky that it looked like it hadn't been cleaned in months.  There was icky stuff in the corners, chipped paint on the floor...it was WAY skeezy for a food establishment.  Then I noticed the cobwebs on the ceiling.  Not one, but a lot. Yes, it's a nice vaulted ceiling, but it shouldn't have cobwebs!!!  What if a spider falls in my drink?  Gross!  Last, and I guess I shouldn't hate on vagrants, but why does the staff have to be all lovey-dovey to the smelly folks that call Starbucks home.  Altogether, it was so gross that I went down the street to another shop.  Starbucks, PLEASE CLEAN THIS STORE.  Eeeeeeeeew.  I can't go back for a while, in hopes that someone in mgmt hears my cry.
author: alli h.

description: This is like the best Starbucks in town so nice from the inside
author: Sulaiman B.

description: This Strabucks is great.... personally me favorite in the whole city.They always have free samples of the food which is great when you want just a bite of something sweet. They also informed me that if you want to add a single pump of flavored syrup that it is free- which I had no idea about and I def have been charged for at other Starbucks. They have great comfy chairs looking onto Union street.
author: Nina Q.

description: Great location, friendly staff, open late. One of my favorite Starbucks. Minus one star for the loud, obnoxious crowd that takes over the window area in the morning.
author: Scott W.

description: Prompt and professional service. Cozy little spot to socialize and do laptop/tablet functions. Strawberry smoothie could have been a little better.
author: Greg T.

description:
The service at this Starbuck's has improved dramatically over the last year. If I had written this a year a ago, I would have given 2 stars - at best. 

When I go to a restaurant or coffee shop, I enjoy seeing the staff having a good time (unhappy employees means there's something wrong), but last year it was just over the top: loud, obnoxious, and even mean-spirited conversations (in my opinion) abound behind the counter. 

The place has made a complete 180 degree turn. The staff is wonderful. The food and coffee are still basic Starbuck's - which I would normally rate at 3 stars. That means I'm actually rating the staff at 7 stars. Crazy.
author: Scott W.

description: I walked into this Starbucks and it was absolutely filthy, trash on the floor, napkins stacked everywhere, cups all over the tables, etc. I mentioned it to the "barista" after I got my drinks and she gave me rude answer. I understand if you just had your Sunday afternoon rush, but being rude on top of it?
author: paul V.

description: This place is not THAT busy at 645 in the morning, but they have found a way to mess up my dirty chai three times in four weeks. All because they write the order wrong or in the wrong box on the side of the cup....Today instead of 3 shots of espresso, the girl running around like it was super packed (when there was 1 person behind me) wrote 3 very sloppily between syrup and shots...meaning I got an extremely sweet chai. Which wouldn't bother me so much if I didn't pay for the espresso shots. Oh and any time I have mentioned this and similar errors to them in follow up visits they simply say sorry. Other Starbucks I have been to at least give you a free-bee on the house to try to make up for it. I should just find another place to get my caffeine fix in the AM, but they are so close to my house and so tasty when they get it right!
author: Erin P.

description:
coffee snob back again, and yes, this Blows too.

if I wanted warm milk I'd get it from mommy
author: david s.

description: I love how you can't see this Starbucks from across the street because of the giant tree in front of it. I walked past it on the other side of Union St. several times before I even realized it was there. Heyyyy, wait a minute... they should put another Starbucks on that corner across the street so people would go to that one too!
author: Chantal H.

description:
This is the best Starbucks in SF that I've found so far.

It doesn't have that funny smell (bathroom + old coffee grounds) that so many Starbucks have, so there's one point.

It also has extremely friendly baristas and I've never seen any crew burn through an out the door line like these people do.  They should film Starbucks training videos here.

Also, since the renovation this summer it's one of the most pleasantly decorated.

Also, really don't like Peete's coffee, it just tastes too bitter.  Is it just me?
author: Matt M.

description:
Every one who walks in to this particular Starbucks really is beautiful.  Objectively beautiful.  (Yes, beauty is objective; no, it is not in the eyes of the beholder.)  And I've always had friendly service from the employees, no matter the time of day or night that I visit, so the place is a veritable Utopia.
 
I did learn one thing on my last visit, though: Watching people eat (fruit oat scones, reduced-fat cinnamon chip mini-loaves, biscotti, etc.) isn't very pretty, no matter where you are.
author: Hannah J.

description: Friendly staff and a couple of nice window seats facing breezy trees across the street.
author: CAKE E.

description: Waaalll....had a blind date here with a guy who was a HS teacher, but he was toooooo UnionStreetBusStop....
author: miriam b.

description: My favorite Starbucks in SF.  Lots of seating and the staff are great.  The lady with the dark straight hair is a machine at the counter and machines.  I sometimes go to other Starbuck's and I just end up getting disappointed.
author: Adam P.

description: I hate to do this to our neighborhood starbucks's that we frequent so often to get through the work day, but it has seriously gone down hill. They used to be on top of their game, and trust me, someone from our office is in there atleast once if not more every day, so I am a good judge of this. Now, the staff and management has changed and it has steadily gone downhill over the past 6 months. It's really too bad because it is very convenient. I will still go, but I hope it gets better.
author: Sarah C.

description: I come to this Starbucks all the time to do homework on the weekends...there's something very different about this Starbucks compared to other ones...the atmosphere is very comfortable and roomy...brings in good vibes..dont ask me how..it just does.
author: M W.

description: Very attentive and friendly. Their fridge section is kept stocked and this place is always packed. They're fairly quick too.
author: Kate S.

description: I am addicted to starbucks brownie bites, if you haven't had them yet go right now and buy the 3 ridiculously overpriced morsels of joy. That being said I get my tea and coffee from la boulange/bay bread next store, but the service at this starbucks is pretty good and friendly.
author: Meg L.

description: I was here today and ordered a latte.  I noticed the register Starbuck asking everyone who ordered a coffee if they wanted a muffin or scone, or anything with their coffee.  Starbucks, please do not try to upsell me with a coffee.  If I wanted a muffin or scone, I would ask for one.
author: apple r.

description: Good wifi. Some cozy sofa chairs. Nice crowd.
author: Ivar S.

description: always very friendly staff.......I never even need to order anymore when I walk in they go ....."Doppio"
author: daniel c.

description: i dunno what some of the other people here are talking about. their customer service is NOT great. i hvae to come here to run coffee errands but wouldn't come here by choice.
author: Erin M.

description: Got refused a dash of hot milk in my machiato by the barista this Sunday (around midday).  I don't come with a sense of entitlement so her rude response and obvious displeasure at my request made me feel like shit.  I ask for a dash of hot milk, any milk she's just heated up, in my machiato, and she says "so did you want a latte then?"  Fail, utter fail.  And fail on my part for not being rude back!
author: Stephanie d.

description:
Lets be honest starbucks are everywhere and not all of them are the same. This one is diffrent, they remember the customer and remember the drinks. There fast, friendly and ready to serve your hot cup of coffee when you get there.

If your ever on chestnut make sure you get some starbucks.:)
author: Elio G.

description: I love this starbucks! I can honestly say all of the baristas are super nice and friendly, its what keeps me coming back for my morning mocha and bagel =)
author: shannon f.
